comment: All the tests are curved. don't expect to receive good test grades on ur own without the curve. Final didn't have a curve, but all tests did? Doesn't make sense. She said if ur final test grade was higher than any of the tests, she'd drop it, but how are you do u score higher on the final If the exams are a curved by a lot&the final isnt? Terrible.
As long as you go to class, pay attention, and do your work,, theres no reason you shouldnt doo well. She's very helpful.

She is very helpful and accommodating but her class is pretty tough. If you have trouble with the homework or quizzes she is always willing to help you. take good notes over the power point slides and ask her if you don't understand something. attendance is not mandatory but it would be wise to go. she always does a review before each test.

Do not take this professor. The quizzes and homework's are online which is great, but her powerpoints are not helpful. I'd recommend buying the book because although it is expensive, her ppts will not do much good to you. I'd rather spend 95 on an online book that will help me rather than stare at 7/8+ ppts with a minimum of atleast 25 slides

Great professor! She goes above and beyond to help her students succeed. Many people mistake her sarcasm for being rude. While she isn't a warm and fuzzy person(most college professors aren't), she is very approachable and always willing to help her students. It's up to you to go to her when you are struggling. She can't read your mind! Take her!

Some students and their posts made previously do not appreciate a professor who just teaches and does not try to micromanage her students or hold their hands while they do homework. During her lectures, this professor constantly ask the class if there are any questions and is always willing to stay after class to help any one who needs it. Take Her

Very good professor! She presents the material very well, it's all on power points that she posts online! Which is great so you can refer back to them when doing homework! So far she's one of the best math professors I've encountered here at KSU. She's also very easy to talk to and will answer any questions either through email or after class.

I am awful at math but got an A in the class. Take this class if you are not good at math. Don't buy the text. All homework/quizzes/tests/final are online. Create a study group and you will get a 100 in the class. Love this professor

Literally stands in front of the class & reads power points that are not the best. Seems annoyed when students ask questions. Everything is online even though it is not a hybrid class. Very young so she understands students but is inexperienced as a professor. Attendance & book are not mandatory.

power points for math? not my thing. if you like to watch someone yell every sentence on a power point for math and don't mind when she gets mad if you ask questions, take the class. attendance is not mandatory, she posts the horrible power points online. book is not mandatory

She wants her students to succeed, so she will help you when you ask for help. She's generous with giving curves and extra points to your test grades. There were 3 tests and a final. The HW and quizzes will help you out a lot with the tests because it's practice. It's not an easy A. You have to do the work.

Awesome teacher, goes above and beyond to help her students out. You get what you put into the class. A little slow at giving back grades but if you need it for an emergency she's more than willing to help get them back. She's willing to help those who do not understand the material. Lot's of extra credit opportunities. Overall, she's great!

She is a very nice woman, but a horrible professor. She does a bad job of teaching the material in class, but her test are extremely hard and complicated. The homework and quizzes were straightforward, and then the test were ridiculous. She is helpful and as much as she complains about helping her students, I think that she does care about them.

I think this was her first semester teaching, only had two classes. Seemed to have trouble keeping on top of grading, posting notes, quizzes, and homework online. I thought her notes were easy to follow and pretty straight forward. The only real problem I'm having is homework was super easy and straight forward while tests were not.
